intro: Cayaponia globosa, commonly known as the globular cayaponia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its spherical, woolly leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
